meanings.definition: Prevent or obstruct (an anticipated event or action) by taking action ahead of time.
meanings.sent1: The clever squirrel was forestalling the other animals from reaching the nuts by hiding them in a secret spot.
meanings.sent2: The farmer set up scarecrows to forestall the birds from eating his crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was forestalling the dog's attempt to chase the butterflies by distracting him with a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The superhero forestalled the villain's evil plan to take over the city.
meanings.sent5: The quick-thinking student forestalled the teacher's surprise quiz by studying every night.

meanings.definition: Buy up (goods) in order to profit by selling them at a higher price when demand exceeds supply.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky merchant was forestalling the market by purchasing all the rare spices before anyone else could.
meanings.sent2: Investors often forestall certain stocks in anticipation of a price increase.
meanings.sent3: The savvy business owner was forestalling the competition by securing a bulk order of the popular product.
meanings.sent4: The collector forestalled the price hike by buying the limited edition item early.
meanings.sent5: The smart shopper forestalled the holiday rush by buying gifts in advance.
